articles.author: NAJIB JOBAIN, SAMY MAGDY and DAVID RISING
articles.description: KHAN YOUNIS, Gaza Strip (AP) — Hamas was preparing to release 14 Israeli hostages Saturday for 42 Palestinian prisoners held by Israel, according to Egyptian officials, in an exchange that comes on the second day of a cease-fire that has allowed critical humanitarian aid into the Gaza Strip and given civilians their first respite after seven weeks of war.
articles.title: Hamas to release 14 Israeli hostages for Israel freeing 42 Palestinians in second swap during truce

articles.author: ISABEL DEBRE
articles.description: BEITUNIA, West Bank (AP) — Over three dozen Palestinian prisoners returned home to a hero's welcome in the occupied West Bank on Friday following their release from Israeli prisons as part of a cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: Palestinian families rejoice over release of minors and women in wartime prisoner swap

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: Derek Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer convicted of murdering George Floyd, was stabbed by another inmate and seriously injured Friday at a federal prison in Arizona, a person familiar with the matter told The Associated Press.
articles.title: Ex-officer Derek Chauvin, convicted in George Floyd's killing, stabbed in prison, AP source says

articles.author: ANNE D'INNOCENZIO and ALEXANDRA OLSON
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Shoppers venturing out to malls and stores on Black Friday found perks from champagne to virtual reality experiences and old-fashioned doorbusters, as retailers tried to entice customers who are resisting splurges and impulse buying this year.
articles.title: Retailers offer bigger Black Friday discounts to lure hesitant shoppers hunting for the best deals

articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia launched Saturday morning its most intense drone attack on Ukraine since the beginning of its full-scale invasion in 2022, targeting the Ukrainian capital, military officials said.
articles.title: Russia launches largest drone attack on Ukraine since start of invasion, says Ukrainian military

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A container ship owned by an Israeli billionaire came under attack by a suspected Iranian drone in the Indian Ocean as Israel wages war on Hamas in the Gaza Strip, an American defense official said Saturday.
articles.title: An Israeli-owned ship was targeted in suspected Iranian attack in Indian Ocean, US official tells AP

articles.author: SARAH EL DEEB
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Gaza has always been a small, crowded space with hardly any exits. Now the world for Palestinians there has shrunk to the size of whatever refuge they can find: a jammed shelter, a car, the walls of a shared apartment, or floors and benches in hospital corridors.
articles.title: Gaza shrinks for Palestinians seeking refuge. 4 stories offer a glimpse into a diminished world

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Ofri Bibas Levy has been haunted by nightmares since Oct. 7, when her brother, sister-in-law and their two young children were snatched by Hamas militants from their homes and dragged into the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Families of hostages not slated for release from Gaza during current truce face enduring nightmare

articles.author: DAVID R. MARTIN and MICHAEL CASEY
articles.description: ELMSFORD, N.Y. (AP) — When Sean Rafferty got his start in the grocery business, anything that wasn't sold got tossed out.But on a recent day, Rafferty, the store manager for ShopRite of Elmsford-Greenburgh in New York, was preparing boxes of bread, donuts, fresh produce and dairy products to be picked up by a food bank.
articles.title: Tackling climate change and alleviating hunger: States recycle and donate food headed to landfills

articles.author: JONATHAN MATTISE and MARIA SHERMAN
articles.description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — Daryl Hall has sued his longtime music partner John Oates, arguing that his plan to sell off his share of a joint venture would violate the terms of a business agreement the Hall & Oates duo had forged.
articles.title: Daryl Hall is suing John Oates over plan to sell stake in joint venture. A judge has paused the sale
